comments.body:
Is this change OK? looks like the structure of kafka-packages on S3 changed at some point. This  URL is the same form I've seen for 1, 1.1, 2.0, and trunk.

\cc @aayars  @maxzheng  @ijuma @ewencp
I remembered @mjsax looked at this part once, could you comment?

I did not change this. `-$version` was removed here: https://github.com/apache/kafka/pull/3454

Maybe never back ported? Seems ok to me.

this is fine as long as someone double checks we moved all the versions. having separate buckets for these never really made sense and i think was just a mistake, as long as we collapsed all previous content into the general bucket, should be fine.

I double checked and it looks to me like they are all there including the list for completeness.
[kafka-packages_aws_list.txt](https://github.com/apache/kafka/files/2357424/kafka-packages_aws_list.txt)

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +64,68 @@
    kafka_dir=/opt/kafka-$version
    url=https://s3-us-west-2.amazonaws.com/kafka-packages/kafka_$scala_version-$version.tgz
    # the .tgz above does not include the streams test jar hence we need to get it separately
    url_streams_test=https://s3-us-west-2.amazonaws.com/kafka-packages/kafka-streams-$version-test.jar

comments.body: Just linking this here for posterity https://github.com/confluentinc/kibosh/commit/8841dd392e6fbf02986e2fb1f1ebf04df344b65a

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +19,23 @@# The version of Kibosh to use for testing.
# If you update this, also update tests/docker/Dockerfile
export KIBOSH_VERSION=8841dd392e6fbf02986e2fb1f1ebf04df344b65a

path_to_jdk_cache() {
